heading: SEC. 1. Short title
content: Protecting American Investment in Shipbuilding Act of 2024

heading: SEC. 2. (a) In general
content: With respect to a United States shipyard that has received Federal financial assistance, if the shipyard becomes majority-owned or controlled by foreign persons or entities, the shipyard shall immediately pay to the Secretary of the Treasury, for deposit in the general fund, an amount equal to all Federal financial assistance previously received by the shipyard.

heading: SEC. 2. (b) Rulemaking
content: The Secretary of the Treasury shall issue such rules as may be necessary to carry out this section.

heading: SEC. 2. (c) Definitions
content: In this section: (1) The term "Federal financial assistance" means any type of financial assistance (including grants, financing, tax credits, or otherwise) provided under any Federal program, includingâ€” (A) title III of the Defense Production Act of 1950; or (B) the CARES Act or any amendment made by the CARES Act. (2) The term "United States shipyard" means a shipyard that is majority-owned by United States persons.

heading: SEC. 3. Prohibition on using Federal funds for capital improvements for shipyards not wholly-owned by United States persons
content: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a shipyard that is not wholly-owned by United States persons may not use Federal funds for capital improvements.
